intro: Jalambica pumila, commonly known as the lesser jalambica, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with potential ecological significance.
